channel.title: Need some clarification and pointers
channel.description: Hi, I'm looking to start my own private server. When I started this little adventure, I thought there would only be a few different server softwares. As you all must know, I was wrong. There are hundreds. I'm looking for a server source that is as close to the current version of runescape as possible, and that is easy to add new content to (Yes, I have plenty of experience with Java.) I'd also like one that comes with a webclient that I can host on my VPS so that people won't need to download a client. One thing that confused is all these numbers: 718, 724, 317, 667. What do those mean? Are they version numbers or something? Thanks to anyone who can help me out or point me in the right direction!

item.title: Need some clarification and pointers
item.dc:creator: @RylandAlmanza RylandAlmanza
item.description:
@RylandAlmanza wrote:

Thanks! Any idea where can I download a 667/727 server? I couldn’t find one here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,488887.0.html

Read full topic

item.title: Need some clarification and pointers
item.dc:creator: @kingcobra805 kingcobra805
item.description:
@kingcobra805 wrote:

the numbers are revisions.
a 667/667 is a 667 loading 667 lol
718/723 is obviously 718 loading 723

the closest you will get to rs graphics is the 667/727

you can make a webclient yourself its easy…
just use jarmaker and a webhost lol

it will not be very easy to add things to the 667 if you’ve worked with 317’s they are a pretty big jump up the list. but just dont be a leecher, be unique.

i hope this helped ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Need some clarification and pointers
item.dc:creator: @RylandAlmanza RylandAlmanza
item.description:
@RylandAlmanza wrote:

Hi, I’m looking to start my own private server. When I started this little adventure, I thought there would only be a few different server softwares. As you all must know, I was wrong. There are hundreds. I’m looking for a server source that is as close to the current version of runescape as possible, and that is easy to add new content to (Yes, I have plenty of experience with Java.) I’d also like one that comes with a webclient that I can host on my VPS so that people won’t need to download a client. One thing that confused is all these numbers: 718, 724, 317, 667. What do those mean? Are they version numbers or something? Thanks to anyone who can help me out or point me in the right direction!
